Best recorder for linux

I used OBS on my 8yo windows 7 laptop to stream to Twitch with great success. This Linux-compatible version is comparable. One issue is the lack of a browser source, which makes StreamLabs and other browser-based widgets almost unusable. The alternative is to open multiple browser windows and open them in each one, which gives them a white background, no transparency, and it takes time to set up before each stream. My stream ends up looking ugly, but it works.

There are so many features!

OBS Studio has consistently been a feature-complete and well-built recording application with basic defaults and a convenient auto-configurator for those who don't want to fiddle with the finer controls. OBS Studio has allowed me to output content with various encoders under various bitrates and resolutions, as well as separate audio streams and control scene switching even while encoding is active. It's no doubt why OBS is used by professional content creators around the world.

Serves it's purpose just right. Straight to the point, great user interface. Super easy to use and GETS THE JOB DONE. 
If you're going to run OBS studio on a device with good RAM, it will work perfectly. If you're like me and run this on a device which struggles with common basic functions, OBS will start to just be BS. But that's a personal problem and other than that, this is the best Live Streaming and Recording application anyone could have ever asked for.
